intro: Triaristella trichaete, commonly known as the hairy triaristella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is often found in grassy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
